title: About
text: I am a graduate student at the University of Texas at Dallas studying a Master of Science in Social Data Analytics and Research. I currently serve as GIS Analyst for AECOM, an infrastructure consulting firm in Dallas, Texas.

title: Abigail Burns
text: Welcome to my Quarto website where I host projects, data stories and more. I am a graduate student at the University of Texas at Dallas studying a Master of Science in Social Data Analytics and Research. I currently serve as GIS Analyst for AECOM, an engineering consulting firm in Dallas, Texas.

title: Train Schedule built with shinyapps

title: Assignment 2
text:
Run an exploratory data analysis with R using the TEDS2016 dataset.

library(haven)
TEDS_2016 <- read_stata("TEDS_2016.dta")
TEDS_2016$PartyID <- factor(TEDS_2016$PartyID, labels=c("KMT","DPP","NP","PFP", "TSU","NPP","NA"))



What problems do you encounter when working with this dataset?
The dataset has a standard deviation of zero.

library(ggplot2)

Warning: package 'ggplot2' was built under R version 4.4.3

ggplot(TEDS_2016, aes(PartyID)) + 
  geom_bar(aes(y = (after_stat(count))/sum(after_stat(count)),fill=PartyID)) + 
  scale_y_continuous(labels=scales::percent) +
  ylab("Party Support (%)") + 
  xlab("Taiwan Political Parties") + 
  theme_bw() + 
  scale_fill_manual(values=c("steel blue","forestgreen","khaki1","orange","goldenrod","yellow","grey"))










How should you deal with missing values?

TEDS_2016 <- na.omit(TEDS_2016)



Explore the relationship between Tondu and other variables female, DPP, age, income, edu, Taiwanese, and Econ_worse. What methods would you use?

TEDS_2016$Tondu <- factor(TEDS_2016$Tondu, labels=c("Unification now","Status quo, unif. in future","Status quo, decide later","Status quo forever","Status quo, indep. in future","Independence now","No response"))
table(TEDS_2016$Tondu, TEDS_2016$female)

                              
                                 0   1
  Unification now               10   8
  Status quo, unif. in future   89  42
  Status quo, decide later     183 168
  Status quo forever            86 114
  Status quo, indep. in future 144 126
  Independence now              34  39
  No response                    8  23

table(TEDS_2016$Tondu, TEDS_2016$DPP)

  Status quo, unif. in future  105  26

  Status quo forever           149  51
  Status quo, indep. in future  87 183
  Independence now              18  55
  No response                   24   7

  Status quo, indep. in future  23  21  65  21 140

library(caret)

Loading required package: lattice

oneHot <- dummyVars(~., data=TEDS_2016)
TEDS_OneHot <- data.frame(predict(oneHot, TEDS_2016))
model.lm <- lm(Tondu.Independence.now ~ 
                 DPP + age + edu + Taiwanese + Econ_worse + pubwelf5,
               data = TEDS_OneHot)
summary(model.lm)


Call:
lm(formula = Tondu.Independence.now ~ DPP + age + edu + Taiwanese + 
    Econ_worse + pubwelf5, data = TEDS_OneHot)

Residuals:
     Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max 
-0.18663 -0.10980 -0.06334  0.00276  1.01239 

Coefficients:
             Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept)  0.153614   0.054533   2.817 0.004939 ** 
DPP          0.056240   0.016670   3.374 0.000768 ***
age         -0.001355   0.000617  -2.197 0.028247 *  
edu         -0.018459   0.006685  -2.761 0.005854 ** 
Taiwanese    0.064875   0.017197   3.772 0.000171 ***
Econ_worse   0.018735   0.015904   1.178 0.239037    
pubwelf5    -0.011122   0.006624  -1.679 0.093432 .  
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 0.2442 on 1067 degrees of freedom
Multiple R-squared:  0.06485,   Adjusted R-squared:  0.05959 
F-statistic: 12.33 on 6 and 1067 DF,  p-value: 1.856e-13




Now explore the votetsai variable (vote for DPP candidate Tsai Ing-wen).
It would be redundant to include both DPP and votetsai in a linear model.

table(TEDS_2016$Tondu, TEDS_2016$votetsai)

                              
                                 0   1
  Unification now               13   5
  Status quo, unif. in future   90  41
  Status quo, decide later     154 197
  Status quo forever           116  84
  Status quo, indep. in future  33 237
  Independence now               8  65
  No response                    4  27




Generate a frequency table and bar chart of the Tondu variable with labels.

ggplot(TEDS_2016, aes(Tondu)) + 
  geom_bar(aes(y = (after_stat(count))/sum(after_stat(count)),fill=Tondu)) + 
  scale_y_continuous(labels=scales::percent) +
  ylab("Tondu Support (%)") + 
  xlab("Taiwan Tondu Attitudes") + 
  theme_bw() + 
  scale_fill_manual(values=c(
    "red","orange","yellow","goldenrod","steelblue","blue","grey"))
